title: OpenAI Teams Up With Foxconn To Design And Manufacture AI Hardware In The US
description: In a strategic move to strengthen the artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure in the United States, OpenAI has partnered with the Taiwanese electronics giant Foxconn.
content:
In a bid to strengthen the artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure in the United States, OpenAI has partnered with the Taiwanese electronics giant Foxconn Technology Group, also known as Hon Hai Precision Industry Co., Ltd (OTC:HNHAF).

description: Wall Street is growing increasingly concerned about the amount of leverage that Big Tech is taking on to build out its artificial intelligence infrastructure as the industry faces rising fears of a bubble.

title: Cancer Stole Her Voice. She Used AI, Curse Words, and Kids’ Books To Get It Back.
description: After a total glossectomy and laryngectomy to treat her cancer, Sonya Sotinsky can no longer speak. She searched for a way to sound like herself again and now pays out-of-pocket for an artificial intelligence app that can replicate her old voice — emotion, inflection, and all.
content:
When doctors told her they had to remove her tongue and voice box to save her life from the cancer that had invaded her mouth, Sonya Sotinsky sat down with a microphone to record herself saying the things she would never again be able to say.
“Happy ... [8474 chars]

title: Advocacy groups urge parents to avoid AI toys this holiday season
description: They warn that artificial-intelligence toys can displace important creative and learning activities. They also have limited or nonexistent parental controls for conversations, a report says.
content:
They’re cute, even cuddly, and promise learning and companionship — but artificial-intelligence toys are not safe for kids, according to children’s and consumer advocacy groups urging parents not to buy them during the holiday season.

title: Guest column: Many risks face the nation. But the national debt is the biggest.
description: What is the largest risk investors face today? The answer may be surprising. There are many possible answers: inflation, interest rates, high stock valuations, global warming, artificial intelligence and nuclear
content:

title: Verizon to lay off 13,000 as US job market shows solid September hiring but also rising joblessness
description: America's job market presents a puzzling picture. September saw more jobs created than expected, yet unemployment reached a four-year high. Verizon is cutting over 13,000 jobs in a major overhaul. These events suggest a shifting economy, influenced by artificial intelligence and corporate cost-saving measures, leading to a more selective hiring approach across industries.
content:

title: Agentic AI in Banking: Transforming Customer Experience and Operational Efficiency
description: Banking is shifting from scripted automation to intelligent decisioning. Traditional Artificial Intelligence (AI) excels at automating tasks and recognizing patterns. But it faces the issue of limited reasoning and veiled context. Plus, it cannot coordinate actions across systems.  Agentic AI changes that.  It can reason, break tasks into steps, and execute end-to-end actions on behalf […]
